title: Wall Street Is Shaking Off Fears of an A.I. Bubble. For Now.
summary: The valuations of some artificial intelligence companies are approaching those of the dot-com boom. But investors worry that pulling money from today’s market risks future gains.

title: Why the A.I. Boom Is Unlike the Dot-Com Boom
summary: Silicon Valley is again betting everything on a new technology. But the mania is not a reboot of the late-1990s frenzy.

title: Trump Eases Limits on Nvidia Exports to China at ‘Critical Moment’
summary: President Trump said Nvidia can export some chips. But years of U.S. restrictions have propelled China to make everything it needs for advanced A.I.

title: Judge Says Ghislaine Maxwell Grand Jury Records Can Be Unsealed, Citing New Epstein Law
summary: The ruling cited a law signed last month by President Trump requiring the Justice Department to release its files on Jeffrey Epstein and his longtime companion, Ghislaine Maxwell.

title: Judge Suggests Lindsey Halligan, Prosecutor on Comey and James Cases, Should Resign
summary: Lindsey Halligan’s indictments against James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, and Letitia James, the attorney general of New York, were dismissed last month over Ms. Halligan’s appointment.

title: Trump Administration Fights Roadblock to Pursuing Comey Case
summary: The battle preceded the department’s looming decision over whether — and how — to bring new charges against James B. Comey.

title: Supreme Court Grapples With Whether to Lift Campaign Finance Limits
summary: The dispute before the court involved a Republican effort to lift limits on how much money political parties can spend in coordination with candidates.

title: Supreme Court Struggles With How to Insulate the Federal Reserve From Politics
summary: The president seemed poised for a big Supreme Court win letting him remove officials without cause. But the justices appeared to struggle with how to insulate the Federal Reserve from politics.

title: As Prices Increase From Tariffs, Trump Administration Goes on the Defensive About Affordability
summary: The president rolled out a $12 billion bailout for farmers as he makes the case that his policy is working — or will soon.

title: Same Product, Same Store, but on Instacart, Prices Might Differ
summary: The findings are the latest example of how the notion of a single price is breaking down in the digital age, a trend economists say could be pushing up some prices.

title: 2025 Best Dishes in America
summary: Crispy fish ssam, knife-cut noodles and more of our favorite bites from a year of eating.

title: 2025 Best Desserts in America
summary: Dulce de leche flan, cherry pie and more of our favorite sweets of the year.

title: In L.A., $750 a Month to Live in a Backyard Storage Unit
summary: A landlord crowded tenants into his house and yard without running water or power. One, determined to find an alternative, was up against the city’s housing crisis.

title: Kamala Harris Isn’t Ready to Be Written Off
summary: She was seen for two decades as a future face of the Democratic Party. Is she now suddenly a figure of its past?

title: Three Years After Dobbs, the State Divide Over Abortion Deepens
summary: The state divide over abortions has only deepened since the Supreme Court decision. But research shows the number of abortions has climbed.

title: The Territorial Sticking Point Between Russia and Ukraine
summary: The Kremlin says any peace deal must cede to Russia the entire eastern Donbas region, including territory Ukraine still controls — a nonstarter for Kyiv.

title: How Australia’s Social Media Ban for Children Will Work
summary: The country is barring children under 16 from social media, with a sweeping federal law that is one of the first attempts at a nationwide regulation.

title: Australia’s Social Media Ban for Under-16s Is Coming. The Teenagers Are Skeptical.
summary: The country is trying to wean children under 16 off the likes of TikTok, Snapchat, YouTube and Instagram with a new law. The teenagers are skeptical.

title: Gov. Pritzker Signs Bill Imposing New Limits on Immigration Enforcement in Illinois
summary: The measure restricts immigration arrests around state courthouses. Republicans have criticized the law and suggested it would face legal challenges.

title: Wrenching Pain, a Severe Infection: An ICE Detainee Is Ordered Released
summary: A judge blamed “deliberate indifference” for the illness of a man held by immigration officials. Across the country, several courts have blasted conditions in U.S. facilities.

title: Looks Like the Supreme Court Will Continue to Overturn the 20th Century
summary: A case over a firing at the F.T.C. has far-reaching implications for the federal government.

title: The Supreme Court Considers Presidential Power
summary: We dig into a case in front of the justices this week.

title: Between Pakistan and Afghanistan, a Trade War With No End in Sight
summary: After deadly cross-border military clashes, the Pakistani and Afghan governments have locked their populations in a trade war threatening the livelihoods of millions.

title: Hundreds of Thousands of Thais and Cambodians Flee
summary: People escaped from a deadly border conflict, the authorities said, with some sheltering at a racetrack in Thailand and others near temples in Cambodia.

title: Iain Douglas-Hamilton, Who Studied, and Protected, Elephants, Dies at 83
summary: Born into an aristocratic British family, he turned his knowledge of the world’s largest land mammals to the cause of saving them from poachers.

title: Canada’s Northwest Territories Diamond Mines Are Closing
summary: After decades of growth driven by diamond mining, Canada’s Northwest Territories are facing the closure of three major mines and wondering: What’s next?
